rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: -extremely unclear due dates -no sakai use -no updated grade  everyone was terrified of failing -inconsistent expectations for attendance and participation -no clear guidelines for any projects -helpful critiques

Wonderful if you need a GPA boost. However, I was really disappointed in the class because we didn't end up following the syllabus, and we didn't seem to do any real work until the final project. She is very vague about her expectations, and didn't return any grades throughout the semester, which made me nervous about my standing in the class

She's an accomplished artist and has made some great work but admittedly doesn't want to teach and this blas√© attitude is evident in her lack of syllabi, unclear instructions, non-existent due dates, and spotty class attendance. As a one-on-one advisor, she can be very helpful. Unfortunately, she is the only sculpture professor at UNC.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Emily is a wonderful teacher and person. She explains reading clearly and picks readings that are interesting and enjoyable. She is always willing to help her students and is willing to hold review sessions for exams outside of class that are incredibly helpful. She is a fair grader and I would love to take another class taught by her.

Although I was not excited about taking a SOC theory class, Emily made the class very enjoyable.  Her explanation of required reading material through lectures is exceptional.  Work load is not too high and she seems to be a fairly easy grader.  I truly enjoyed this course, but only because Emily taught it.
